channel.title: Help with npcs

item.title: Help with npcs
item.dc:creator: @yourusername yourusername
item.description:
@yourusername wrote:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 920) {
if (misc.random2(30) <= 2) {
npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
npcs[i].textUpdate = “welcome to server”;
}
}

that’s mine and it works so ye

item.title: Help with npcs
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

Can you kids look at the autospawn?
It’s extremely fucked up.

spawn = 1063   3091   3482   2   1000   4242   5151   5151   1   StationaryNPC
spawn = 1063   3096   3482   2   1000   4242   5151   5151   1   StationaryNPC 
spawn = 1063   3091 3482  0   0   0   0   0   1   StationaryNPC
spawn = 1063   3096  3482  0   0   0   0   0   1   StationaryNPC

Unless you want your NPC to be moving around.

I don’t think you should be guessing what to put in the other values.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with npcs
item.dc:creator: @i0wnuall i0wnuall
item.description:
@i0wnuall wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:8, topic:259191”][quote author=i0wnuall link=topic=342253.msg2646618#msg2646618 date=1233269487]
Just take the if (misc.random2(30) <= 2) { out of there and delete a } from the bottom of the coding.
If it doesn’t work just re add it…
[/quote]
Lol. okayyy

What the hell? Doing that it won’t make the npc keep saying the message. It will probably only say it once and not say it anymore. To Server Creator Brian, use coding tags when posting a code. Also, try this instead:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1063) { if (misc.random2(30) <= 2) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome to Server"; } }

It may depend on your source whether or not that will work. And if that’s the case, it will give you errors so make sure to either back it up or delete it if it does. Tell me if that works.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Help with npcs
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“i0wnuall, post:4, topic:259191”]Just take the if (misc.random2(30) <= 2) { out of there and delete a } from the bottom of the coding.
If it doesn’t work just re add it…[/quote]

What the hell? Doing that it won’t make the npc keep saying the message. It will probably only say it once and not say it anymore. To Server Creator Brian, use coding tags when posting a code. Also, try this instead:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 1063) { if (misc.random2(30) <= 2) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome to Server"; } }

It may depend on your source whether or not that will work. And if that’s the case, it will give you errors so make sure to either back it up or delete it if it does. Tell me if that works.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with npcs
item.dc:creator: @Server_Creator_Brian Server Creator Brian
item.description:
@Server_Creator_Brian wrote:

Hellllllllllpp… I need a welcome npc to say “Welcome to (myservername)” (cant advt) heres what i got in my Npchandler.java…

                if (npcs[i].npcType == 1063) {
                    if (misc.random2(30) <= 2) {
                        npcs[i].updateRequired = true;
                        npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true;
                        npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome to Server";
                    }
                }

And in my autospawn.cfg…

spawn = 1063 3091 3482 2 1000 4242 5151 5151 1 StationaryNPC
spawn = 1063 3096 3482 2 1000 4242 5151 5151 1 StationaryNPC

What am i doing wrong?

Read full topic
